body: The way `int[3]` is used in the project makes the `3` more a part of the function declaration than part of the list type for the argument.  In particular, `int[3]` doesn't mean 'I expect a list whose size is statically 3', but instead, 'If someone tries to pass an int here, you can make it into an appropriate list by repeating it 3 times'. If we tried to encode it into the type, I would expect it to have the former meaning and to prevent using a list of unknown length in its place. By putting N in the argument list rather than the type, it is clear it affects the behavior of the call site but still accepts normal lists as arguments.
